headline: What's News: Business & Finance
summary: What's News: Business & Finance Top Stories for July 22, 2010

headline: Correction
summary: Jeremy Grantham, the chief investment strategist at GMO, was incorrectly identified as the company's chief executive in an op-ed, "Hard Knocks From Easy Money," on July 6.

headline: Pepper...and Salt
summary: Pepper...and Salt

headline: Lawmakers Press BP's Partners
summary: U.S. lawmakers are pressing Anadarko Petroleum and a unit of Japan's Mitsui & Co. to start paying some of the costs related to the Gulf of Mexico oil spill and to set aside money for future expenses.

headline: Corporate Watch
summary: Corporate Watch

headline: Germany Drops Investigation of Bishop
summary: Prosecutors dropped an investigation into Germany's top-ranking Catholic bishop after finding no proof that he had knowingly allowed a priest accused of sexually abusing a child in the 1960s to be assigned to a parish some two decades later.

headline: Smartphone Woes Hurt Nokia Results
summary: Nokia's CEO urged an end to speculation surrounding his future at the company, as the world's largest mobile phone maker said its second-quarter profit fell 40%.

headline: Contador Set to Repeat as Tour Champ
summary: Schleck fails to gain enough ground on Contador during a photo finish on the storied Tourmalet peak.

headline: Freed Russian Hopes to Return Home
summary: Igor Sutyagin, the physicist deported from Russia early this month as part of the exchange for 10 Russian agents arrested in the U.S., broke his two-week silence, with a statement saying he misses his family and hopes to return to Russia at some point.

headline: Everbright To Launch $2.9 Billion IPO
summary: China Everbright Bank is planning an August launch for its IPO that  could raise up to $2.9 billion, a source said.

headline: SanDisk CEO Harari to Retire at Year-End
summary: SanDisk CEO Eli Harari will retire at year-end, the company said, surprising investors after revenue came in roughly in line with Wall Street expectations.

headline: U.S. Supports New IMF Loan Programs
summary: The U.S. supports developing new International Monetary Fund loan programs and reconsidering the IMF's funding resources, a senior U.S. official said.

headline: Bernanke Faces Lawmakers for Second Day
summary: Bernanke reiterated in a second day of congressional testimony that he is prepared to take further action to support the economy if the outlook deteriorates, but indicated reluctance to do so.

headline: Courtside Living
summary: Tour homes with tennis courts in Pound Ridge, N.Y., Lakewood, Wash., and Poway, Calif., all priced at less than $2 million.

headline: Chesapeake CEO to Auction Ranch
summary: Aubrey McClendon is auctioning the 4,400-acre property in Oklahoma on August 5. Also, a 17,000-square-foot mansion in Rhode Island is listed for $24 million, and boxing promoter Don King has taken a Florida estate off the market.

headline: Judge Denies New Trial in 'Squawk' Box Case
summary: A judge ruled that the criminal convictions of three former stockbrokers and three former members of a defunct day trading firm's management will stand in a scheme to misuse brokerage firm "squawk" boxes.

headline: Snack-Food Makers Lance, Snyder's to Merge
summary: Snack-food company Lance said it will combine with pretzel maker Snyder's of Hanover in a stock-for-stock merger.

headline: Ford to Return to Profitability
summary: Ford is expected to report a second-quarter profit of $1.6 billion Friday, compared to a $424 million loss a year ago, on its growing ability to sell pricier models.

headline: American Eagle Blames IBM as Website Fails Again
summary: American Eagle's website is down for a third straight day, depriving it of a sales channel at the start of the back-to-school shopping season. The teen retailer blamed IBM for the problem.

headline: AutoNation's Profit Rises 29%
summary: AutoNation reported much-improved earnings as a result of the continuing recovering in new-vehicle sales in the U.S.

headline: Revenue Rises at the Times
summary: New York Times reported lower profits, reflecting year-earlier gains, but quarterly revenue rose for the first time in almost three years.

headline: UPS Profit Surges
summary: UPS reported a 90% jump in profit, driven by Asian trade and what the package shipper views as a moderate but steady U.S. recovery.

headline: Pictures of the Day: July 22
summary: In today's photos, five people are killed in a fire in Staten Island, police officers destroy video games, sheep get in the way of cyclists, and more.

headline: Bernanke's Balancing Act
summary: In the late 1990s, U.S. economists talked optimistically about a "Goldilocks Economy" of low inflation and healthy growth. A decade later, the Fed is grappling with the opposite dilemma.

headline: ABB Profit Drops 8%
summary: ABB reported an 8% drop in net profit, but said it saw the first signs of a broader market recovery amid a pickup in demand.

headline: Crude Rises on Storm Worries
summary: Crude futures rose after posting the highest front-month price since May, as a tropical depression headed for the Gulf of Mexico and equities rallied.

headline: House Passes Jobless Extension
summary: The House voted to approve an extension of jobless benefits through November, and President Obama is expected to sign the bill into law soon.

headline: Union Pacific's Profit Rises
summary: Union Pacific's profit climbed 53% as the railroad operator posted volume growth for a second consecutive period.

headline: New Securities Issues
summary: The following were among recent offerings and pricings in U.S. and non-U.S. capital markets, with terms and syndicate manager, based on information provided by Dow Jones Newswires and Factiva.

headline: Venezuela Cuts Ties With Colombia
summary: President Hugo Chavez severed all diplomatic ties with neighboring Colombia and ordered "maximum alert" on the border, following charges by Bogota that Colombian rebel leaders were stationed in Venezuela.

headline: Roche Posts 58% Profit Jump
summary: Roche Holding reported a sharp rise in first-half net profit due to accelerated drug sales and the absence of charges linked to the takeover of Genentech and said it expects to reach its 2010 goals.

headline: Mosque Plan for Staten Island Suffers Setback
summary: The trustees of Saint Margaret Mary parish on Staten Island have voted against the controversial sale of a convent to the Muslim American Society.

headline: Demand for Treasurys Wanes
summary: Treasury prices fell, pushing the benchmark 10-year note's yield up from a 15-month low, as better-than-forecast data from the U.S. and Europe dented demand for safe assets.

headline: Hynix Swings to Profit
summary: Hynix Semiconductor swung to a second-quarter profit, but the South Korean chip maker cautioned that chip prices might decline in coming quarters.

headline: Capital Fund Takes AgBank Stake
summary: A fund that belongs to Capital Group of Cos. paid $1.63 billion for a 1.24% stake in Agricultural Bank of China on the Chinese lender's debut in Hong Kong last week.

headline: LG Display Warns of Panel-Price Fall
summary: Flat-panel maker LG Display said its quarterly net profit rose 51%, but the company warned its panel prices will likely fall next quarter due to slowing demand.

headline: Safeway Lowers Outlook
summary: Safeway reported a 41% drop in second-quarter earnings, and the grocer indicated it will continue to feel the sting of lower prices.

headline: Imperfect Timing
summary: None

headline: Conoco to Book Charge for German Refinery
summary: ConocoPhillips will take a $1.1 billion non-cash charge to second quarter earnings after deciding to abandon plans to upgrade a Germany oil-refinery. It will now sell the plant or use it for storage.

headline: Lunch at Momofuku
summary: Although evening waits for seats at Momofuku Ssäm Bar can stretch an hour or more, at weekday lunch, diners often have the restaurant to themselves.

headline: St. Jude Earnings Climb On Heart-Rhythm Devices
summary: St. Jude Medical posted a 16% climb in second-quarter earnings and raised its full-year forecast, backed by sales gains in a heart-rhythm devices business.

headline: Baxter's Profit Drops 8.9%
summary: Baxter International's second-quarter earnings fell 8.9%, including a charge, as it faced macroeconomic headwinds and individual product issues.

headline: Zimmer Profit Hit by Charges
summary: Zimmer's second-quarter profit slid 21% as it took a charge for legal costs and other items, but the company's replacement hips-and-knees business posted gains.

headline: Smartphone Shift Lifts Qualcomm's Net
summary: Qualcomm's quarterly profit rose 4.1% on demand for smartphones running its chips, and said it is exploring options for its FLO TV business.

headline: Royal Caribbean Posts Profit
summary: Royal Caribbean Cruises reported a second-quarter profit and raised its 2010 earnings guidance by 10 cents a share.

headline: Roche's Ongoing Health Scares
summary: Management at the Swiss pharmaceutical company has its work cut out to get the group back on the right foot.

headline: Swedbank Returns to a Profit
summary: Swedbank swung to a net profit on lower loan-loss provisions and said it sees macroeconomic strength in home markets.

headline: Janus Profit Soars 91% on Management-Fee Jump
summary: Janus Capital Group's second-quarter earnings soared 91% as the asset manager continued to report growth in assets under management and investment fees after the prior-year's weak performance.

headline: Five of Six Greek Banks Seen Passing Test
summary: Greece's leading private lenders are expected to pass an upcoming health check of Europe's banking sector, but questions remain over one of the two state-controlled banks being tested.

headline: Stocks in Europe Climb
summary: European stocks finished sharply higher, with investors setting aside fears regarding Friday's bank stress-test results and embracing stronger-than-expected economic data.

headline: Supreme Court Nominations Join Partisan Battleground
summary: When senators vote on Elena Kagan's Supreme Court confirmation in early August, they are likely to split roughly along party lines in a reflection of how such nominations have become a full-scale part of culture wars.

headline: BofA to Sell Warburg Fund Stakes
summary: Bank of America is in the process of selling $1.2 billion in commitments made to funds managed by Warburg Pincus as part of a process to reduce its exposure to private equity.

headline: Ocado Deal Not So Ripe
summary: Despite so much that is praiseworthy about Ocado, there is something disturbing and disappointing about the way its initial public offering has proceeded.

headline: Best Summer Wines
summary: Wine columnist Will Lyons sipped, slurped and spat his way through dozens of samples to come up with a summer wine list of sparkling, white, rosé and red — 20 wines for every summertime occasion.

headline: Medco Profit Up 14%
summary: Medco's second-quarter profit rose 14%, as revenue increased more than expected.

headline: Xerox Profit Jumps 62%
summary: Xerox said profit jumped 62% as sales improved across the board. The printer-and-copier maker also raised its 2010 earnings forecast.

headline: Eli Lilly Profit Rises 16%; Bristol Posts 5.7% Drop
summary: None

headline: Daiwa Expects Bigger Asia Revenue
summary: Japan's second-largest brokerage firm, Daiwa Securities, expects to triple revenues generated in Asia over the next couple of years as it continues its push into the region's fast-growing economies.

headline: Equitable Life Payout Could Be Under £500 Million
summary: The U.K. Treasury could end up paying out less than half a billion pounds to policyholders affected by the near-collapse of Equitable Life.

headline: Cigarette Makers Raise Outlook
summary: Philip Morris said earnings rose on higher retail prices and a jump in shipment volume in Asia. Reynolds' profit fell. Both companies raised their profit outlook.

headline: Are Designer Sunglasses Worth the Price?
summary: Maybe not, writes Brett Arends. For starters, most shades are made by the same company. Here's what you need to know before buying.

headline: Couche-Tard Raises Casey's Bid
summary: Canada's Couche-Tard increased its hostile offer for convenience-store operator Casey's General Stores to about $1.9 billion.

headline: Hershey Profit Drops 34%
summary: Hershey's earnings slid 34% as the company spent more heavily on advertising and absorbed costs to make its manufacturing and distribution more effective.

summary: The 10-year Japanese government-bond yield hit a nearly seven-year low on strong results of a 20-year auction and concerns over the U.S. economic outlook.

headline: Asia Ends Mixed on Bernanke, Yen
summary: Asian shares ended mixed as Ben Bernanke's downbeat assessment of the U.S. economic outlook spooked investors, sending Japanese stocks lower for a fifth straight session.

headline: The Downside to Baidu's Upside
summary: As China's dominant Internet search engine company, Baidu should tread gently with its big feet.

headline: Gold Climbs Near $1,200
summary: Gold futures rose amid a rally in riskier assets as traders focused on positive earnings reports and euro-zone economic data.

headline: Richard Lord: Murali the Magnificent
summary: The man who transformed Sri Lanka's cricket side from also-rans into contenders.

headline: Ocado Faces Retail Race to Withdraw Offers
summary: Ocado customers who made commitments to buy stock in the company within a higher price range have until midnight Thursday to withdraw their offers.

headline: Résumé Overload? A Shortcut to Spot Best Hires
summary: Job seekers desperate for paychecks are responding to every job opening, whether they're qualified or not. Here's a filtering technique to pinpoint best candidates.

headline: Elan's Net Loss Widens
summary: Irish drug maker Elan reported a wider net loss, after the company set aside $206.3 million to settle a U.S. government investigation into Elan's marketing of the epilepsy drug Zonegran.

headline: Credit Suisse's Lackluster Quarter
summary: Investment banks suffered in the second quarter, and Credit Suisse was no exception.

headline: 3M Profit Jumps as Sales Rebound
summary: 3M said its earnings rose 43% as the consumer and industrial manufacturer's sales rebounded. It also raised again its earnings guidance.

headline: Dubai World Presents Debt Plan to Creditors
summary: Dubai World said a meeting to present details of its proposed $23.5 billion debt restructuring to creditors was an "informational session" and no resolution was sought. Some creditors who attended said they weren't happy with the plan.

headline: Violence Continues in Yemen
summary: As many as 60 people have died in five days of fighting between government-allied tribes and rebels in Yemen's north, security officials said, threatening a cease-fire the government and the rebels signed in February.

headline: U.K. Posts Strong Retail Sales
summary: U.K. retail sales rose more than expected in June, boosted by promotions and the soccer World Cup.

headline: Pearson Expands Brazil Footprint
summary: U.K. publisher Pearson said it bought SEB's learning-systems business for $494.5 million as part of a strategic partnership to develop educational products and services for the fast-growing Brazilian education market.

headline: FDA Issues Hold on Avandia Study
summary: The FDA said Wednesday it's placed a partial hold on an ongoing clinical study involving Glaxo's diabetes drug Avandia.

headline: Storm Claims Hit Travelers Profit
summary: Record claims costs from storms in the Midwest caused profit to fall 9.5% at Travelers, while the poor economy forced the insurer to reduce its estimate for its full-year profits.

summary: Bajaj Auto beat market estimates with a two-fold jump in quarterly net profit, as it sold more motorcycles and gained from higher non-operating income.

summary: TVS Motor beat expectations as its fiscal first quarter net profit more than doubled after higher vehicle sales outweighed a rise in prices of raw materials such as steel and aluminum.

summary: Netflix posted sharply higher earnings on strong revenue growth, but its share price fell as a measure of marketing expense disappointed investors.

headline: New Delhi's Growing Will to Reform
summary: Often labeled flatfooted when it comes to delivering on fiscal reforms, New Delhi is working hard to lose that badge.

summary: Starwood Hotels reported a 15% drop in earnings on charges as the lodging company continued to see improved demand.

headline: Altria Profit Rises Slightly
summary: Altria's earnings rose 3.2% as cigarette volume again declined, but demand for smokeless tobacco continued to rise.

headline: India Starts Talks to Buy BP Stake in Vietnam Gas Block

headline: Danaher Profit Rises 26%
summary: Danaher's second-quarter profit rose 26% on better-than-expected sales.

headline: SABMiller Sells Less Beer
summary: Global brewer SABMiller said its volumes once again declined in its fiscal first quarter, despite rising briefly in the previous three months.

summary: Sri Lanka's Muttiah Muralitharan became the first bowler to take 800 test wickets. Some snapshots.

headline: Ousted Kyrgyz President's Brother Arrested
summary: Kyrgyzstan's Interior Ministry said it had detained one of ousted President Kurmanbek Bakiyev's brothers, suspected of involvement in recent deadly unrest in the country's south.

summary: U.S. Secretary of State Hillary Clinton tours South Asia in bid to improve bilateral ties and secure firmer support for the war in Afghanistan.

headline: Flying Algae-Powered Planes
summary: Aviation isn't the only sector looking into the uses of algae as a fuel, but it could do with its help bringing down carbon emissions more than most.

headline: Volvo Profits From More Orders
summary: Swedish truck maker Volvo reported its second consecutive quarterly net profit as its order intake rose, but stuck to its forecast for 20% to 30% growth in North America over the year.

summary: India's food price inflation rose 0.6% in the week ended July 10, reversing a recent easing run and firming expectations of fresh rate hikes by the central bank next week.

headline: Banks Deposit Fewer Funds at ECB
summary: Use of the ECB's 0.25% deposit facility fell to its lowest level since March, as the recent rise in short-term rates continued to tease the excess reserves back into circulation.

summary: Anadarko and Mitsui & Co., BP's minority partners in the leaking Gulf of Mexico oil well, are taking steps to distance themselves from the disaster and the mounting financial obligations that have followed.

headline: Investors in Gulf Oil Well Distance Themselves From Spill
summary: The two companies that held minority stakes in the well that caused the Gulf of Mexico oil spill are taking steps to distance themselves from the disaster and the mounting financial obligations that have followed.

headline: Group Eases Limits on  Births After C-Sections
summary: Updated guidelines from an influential physician group may make it easier for  women to give birth vaginally after a cesarean.

headline: Stars Help Open Harlem Target
summary: The chic and cheap retailer celebrated with a massive block party that brought out Jerry and Jessica Seinfeld, Kelly Rowland and Elizabeth Banks.

headline: Apple's Heavy Caseload
summary: So, not only is the reception on Apple's new iPhone arguably worse than that of its predecessor, it turns out the iPhone 4 is less profitable than the 3GS.

headline: Starbucks Net Climbs
summary: Starbucks fiscal-third-quarter earnings rose 37% on improved sales tied to increased customer visits and after year-ago charges.

headline: Oil Firms to Create Spill-Response System
summary: Four of the world's largest oil companies are creating a strike force to stanch oil spills in the deep waters of the Gulf of Mexico in a billion-dollar bid to regain the confidence of the White House.

headline: When USB 3 Will Be Mainstream
summary: Walt answers readers' questions on USB 3, and how syncing works.

headline: Commodities Fall as China Cools Growth
summary: A moderate slowdown in China's economic growth is reverberating through global markets because of the country's outsize role as a buyer of metals, minerals and other commodities.

headline: Windows 7 Boosts Microsoft
summary: Microsoft's profit climbed 48% as the software giant benefited from a strong response to the Windows 7 operating system.

headline: Fashion Sites Try to Lure Guys
summary: Online fashion shopping sites have been a hit with women since launching over the last three years. A new push to get men to shop in these web boutiques is proving more difficult.

headline: Blagojevich Won't Take Stand
summary: Former Illinois Gov. Rod Blagojevich pulled the plug on his plan to take the stand in his federal corruption trial, cutting short a trial that had been expected to last all summer.

headline: Bernanke Prepared to Take New Steps
summary: Bernanke in congressional testimony signaled that no moves were imminent to bolster the recovery despite a "somewhat weaker outlook" for the economy.

headline: Europe, Asia Mostly Higher
summary: European markets rose Wednesday, boosted by upbeat earnings and further evidence of a pickup in merger activity. Asian markets gained, too, as steel stocks rallied on news China is aiming to consolidate the local industry.

headline: Julius Baer Eyes New Markets
summary: Swiss private bank Julius Baer said it would continue to scour for acquisitions to pursue growth in newer markets such as Asia and Germany.

headline: Obama Girl Is Nowhere to Be Found
summary: JOHN FUND ON THE TRAIL  A plurality of voters believe the country would have been better off if John McCain had beaten Mr. Obama in 2008.

headline: Son of Cap and Tax
summary: The destructive fine print in Harry Reid's energy bill.

headline: Virus Attacks Siemens Systems
summary: Computer hackers have designed a virus that targets industrial control systems built by German engineering giant Siemens.

headline: Older Lawyers Resist Forced Retirement
summary: Older attorneys are fighting back against policies at many law firms designed to encourage older partners to retire.

headline: Hancock Sinks 16%; Piper Jaffray Drops 6%
summary: Small-capitalization stocks slid after Bernanke's testimony unnerved investors hoping for a more comforting outlook for the economic recovery.

headline: Hon Hai Broaches Price Boost
summary: Electronics maker Hon Hai Precision Industry said it will discuss with clients the possibility of raising product prices to offset planned wage increases for its employees.

headline: Motorola Claims Huawei Plot
summary: Motorola has sued Huawei Technologies, alleging that China's largest telecommunications equipment company stole its trade secrets.

headline: The Apollo 13 Spirit Needed in the Gulf
summary: Michio Kaku could have added toxic leadership to his list of "What We've Learned from the Gulf Spill" (op-ed, July 20). When the Apollo 13 mishap crippled the spacecraft on its way to the moon, President Richard Nixon could have excoriated the contractors on TV and demanded that they come in and do something—no doubt dooming the mission.

headline: Blockbuster From China
summary: China's most commercially successful film director, Feng Xiaogang, talks about his latest film, the two-earthquake family saga "Aftershock."

headline: Angel Investors Get Backers of Their Own
summary: Some Silicon Valley venture capitalists are putting money into funds run by angel investors to back start-ups in their earliest stages.

headline: Ex-NASD Official Under Scrutiny for Work at Stanford Group
summary: Ex-NASD official Bernerd Young said in a filing with the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority that he received a Wells notice from the SEC.

headline: Chinatown's Kosher Vegetarian Haven
summary: Because seating is limited, the lunchtime rush at Buddha Bodai may have you eating shoulder-to-shoulder with strangers—who, Mr. Zhang says, are likely to be 'Jewish, Chinese monks or hippies.'

headline: Uneven Rebound in Housing Market
summary: Home values in major Bay Area cities are rising again. But a close look shows how much the region's housing market remains off its peak and how widely individual homeowners' experiences have varied.

headline: Drill Ban Hits Services Firms
summary: About 11,000 people packed the Cajundome to protest the federal government's ban on deepwater drilling, which they say could damage their region even more than BP PLC's massive oil spill.

headline: Aid and AIDS in Malawi
summary: Handouts improve health outcomes, but lasting well-being requires self-sufficiency.

headline: Japan Leaders Push Spending, Cuts
summary: Japan's ruling party pushed to add about $23 billion in the coming budget to economic growth efforts but proposed funding the effort by eliminating waste and existing programs.

summary: Pamella DeVos, creative director of the Pamella Roland eveningwear label, believes that women often pick summer ensembles that are too elaborate.

headline: Euro Rally Is Prelude to a Fall
summary: The euro's recent rally may be little more than a summer fling. While the currency has benefited from improved sentiment toward Europe, many say the rally really reflects of concerns about the U.S. economy.

headline: Sarah McLachlan Kicks Off Tour at JFK
summary: After performing in sold-out arenas, playing in an airport terminal may seem like a downgrade, but not for singer-songwriter Sarah McLachlan.

headline: Fred Barnes: The Vast Left-Wing Media Conspiracy
summary: Everyone knew most of the press corps was hoping for Obama in 2008. Newly released emails show that hundreds of them were actively working to promote him.

headline: Merkel Defends Cuts as Ratings Fall
summary: German Chancellor Angela Merkel defended her government's austerity measures, saying they are good for economic growth despite their unpopularity with German voters and foreign governments.

headline: How Two Galaxy Phones Stack Up
summary: After tests of the T-Mobile Vibrant and the AT&T Captivate, Walt Mossberg finds they have some attributes the iPhone lacks.

headline: Piper Jaffray Profit Tumbles
summary: Piper Jaffray Cos.' second-quarter profit fell a much more-than-expected 40% on surging interest expenses. The CEO of the investment bank, which caters to smaller companies, called it a "mixed performance."

headline: Dr. Reddy's Profit Retreats 14%
summary: Indian drug maker Dr. Reddy's reported a steeper-than-expected 14% drop in first-quarter consolidated net profit, dragged down mainly by lower sales in the North American market.

headline: Standardized Medicine Doesn't Mean Better Medicine
summary: Regarding Daniel Henninger's "Berwick: Bigger than Kagan" (Wonder Land, July 15): I am writing to expose Dr. Donald Berwick's suggestions for reform as being naively "cookbook" and unrealistic.

headline: Experts Ask Why BP Delayed Cap
summary: With BP's blown-out Gulf of Mexico oil well now effectively capped, some experts are questioning why the company didn't attempt a similar procedure earlier.

summary: The U.S. risks wasting the aid it is offering earthquake-torn Haiti, which hasn't made needed reforms, a Senate report to be released Thursday says.

headline: Fine Art of Cigar Boxes
summary: Over the weekend, the East End Hospice held its annual Box Art Auction at the Ross School in East Hampton, involving 75 artists creating new works out of cigar boxes.

headline: Curry Heat Wave on East 6th Street
summary: Rowdy crowds are flocking to Brick Lane Curry House to try a hellishly hot curry called phaal , which contains 10 different chilies and emits so much heat that chefs wear a protective mask while making it.

headline: EBay's Turnaround Slow
